location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 4 from Ephraim Gerrish Stannus, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire Residency to William Newnham, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is informing the Bombay Government that Merza Mohomed Ally Khan [Mīrzā Muḥammad ‘Alī Khān], a native of Hindostan [Hindustan], is proceeding to India aboard the HC Cruizer Aurora; the Resident has rendered this assistance because he did not have the means to make it to India by his own private resources.It is noted that Merza Mohomed Ally Kham arrived at Bushire from Tehran highly recommended by the authorities in Persia, along with letters of introduction to the Governor of Bombay and Lord Amherst.
